name: Living Off The Land Binaries (LOLBins) Abuse
description: Comprehensive hunt package for detecting adversary abuse of legitimate Windows utilities like certutil, rundll32, regsvr32, and others for malicious purposes
hypothesis: Adversaries leverage trusted system binaries to download payloads, execute code, and evade security controls without triggering traditional AV signatures
default_query: process_name in ("certutil.exe", "rundll32.exe", "regsvr32.exe", "mshta.exe", "bitsadmin.exe") AND (command_line contains "http" OR command_line contains "download" OR command_line contains "/i:" OR command_line contains "javascript:" OR command_line contains "vbscript:")
investigation_steps: Query for suspicious LOLBin process executions with network indicators
Analyze command line arguments for download or execution patterns
Correlate with network traffic to identify payload sources
Review parent process relationships for execution context
Check process execution time and user context for anomalies
Validate against known-good administrative activities
detection_tuning: Whitelist approved administrative scripts and tools
Filter scheduled maintenance windows
Exclude software deployment processes
Focus on user-initiated executions vs system processes

name: DNS Tunneling Detection
description: Identify covert channels using DNS protocol for command and control communications or data exfiltration through analysis of query patterns, entropy, and response characteristics
hypothesis: Attackers use DNS tunneling to bypass network security controls and maintain covert communication channels with compromised systems
default_query: dns_query_length > 50 OR dns_subdomain_count > 5 OR dns_query_entropy > 3.5 OR dns_response_type = "TXT" OR dns_txt_record_length > 200 OR (dns_queries_per_minute > 30 AND dns_unique_subdomains > 10)
investigation_steps: Identify DNS queries with abnormal length or subdomain structure
Calculate entropy of DNS queries to detect encoded data
Analyze TXT record responses for hidden payloads
Review query frequency and patterns for automation
Correlate suspicious domains with threat intelligence
Examine source hosts for other indicators of compromise
detection_tuning: Baseline normal DNS query patterns by subnet/department
Whitelist legitimate services using DNS for configuration (e.g., Office 365)
Exclude internal DNS resolution for local domains
Adjust entropy thresholds based on environment

name: Kerberoasting Attack Detection
description: Hunt for service ticket requests (TGS-REP) indicating Kerberoasting attacks where adversaries request service tickets for accounts with SPNs to crack passwords offline
hypothesis: Adversaries with valid domain credentials request service tickets for privileged service accounts to extract and crack passwords offline
default_query: event_id = 4769 AND ticket_encryption_type in (0x17, 0x18) AND service_name NOT IN ("krbtgt", "kadmin", "kadmin/admin", "kadmin/changepw") AND (requested_tickets_5min > 5 OR requested_unique_spns_1hour > 10)
investigation_steps: Query for TGS-REP requests with RC4 or older encryption types
Identify accounts requesting multiple unique SPNs in short timeframe
Review requesting account privileges and typical behavior
Correlate with anomalous authentication patterns
Validate targeted service accounts for weak passwords
Check for follow-on privilege escalation attempts
detection_tuning: Whitelist legitimate service accounts and automated processes
Exclude monitoring/scanning tools that enumerate SPNs
Filter normal administrator activity during business hours
Adjust thresholds based on domain size and activity

success_criteria.coverage: All Kerberos service ticket requests monitored

name: Data Exfiltration via Cloud Storage
description: Detect unauthorized data uploads to public cloud storage services (Dropbox, Google Drive, OneDrive, MEGA, Box) that may indicate data theft by insiders or compromised accounts
hypothesis: Insiders or compromised accounts exfiltrate sensitive data by uploading to personal or attacker-controlled cloud storage services
default_query: network_dst_domain matches "*.dropbox.com|*.box.com|*.mega.nz|drive.google.com|onedrive.live.com|*.wetransfer.com" AND (bytes_out > 50MB OR file_count > 100) AND user NOT IN approved_cloud_users AND (time_hour < 6 OR time_hour > 20 OR is_weekend = true)
investigation_steps: Identify large or bulk uploads to public cloud services
Review user account and typical data access patterns
Analyze uploaded file types and sensitivity classification
Check for off-hours or weekend activity
Correlate with HR indicators (resignation, PIP, access to sensitive data)
Review user's recent authentication and access history
detection_tuning: Whitelist approved corporate cloud storage accounts
Exclude IT/DevOps teams with legitimate cloud access
Adjust size thresholds based on job roles
Filter sanctioned file sharing during business hours

success_criteria.coverage: All major cloud storage providers monitored

name: Persistence via Scheduled Tasks
description: Hunt for suspicious Windows scheduled task creation that adversaries use to maintain persistence and execute malicious code on a recurring basis
hypothesis: Attackers create scheduled tasks running malicious scripts or executables to maintain access after initial compromise
default_query: event_id = 4698 AND (task_command contains "powershell" OR task_command contains "cmd.exe" OR task_command contains "wscript" OR task_command contains "cscript" OR task_command contains "mshta") AND (task_command contains "http" OR task_command contains "download" OR task_command contains "invoke" OR task_command contains "hidden" OR task_command contains "bypass") AND (task_run_as = "SYSTEM" OR task_run_as = "Administrator")
investigation_steps: Query for new scheduled task creations (Event ID 4698)
Analyze task commands for suspicious scripts or execution patterns
Review task execution context (user, privileges, timing)
Examine task creation time and creating user/process
Investigate task target executables and scripts
Correlate with other persistence mechanisms on same host
detection_tuning: Whitelist legitimate software installers creating tasks
Exclude system maintenance and backup tasks
Filter approved administrative automation
Focus on user-context tasks with elevated privileges

success_criteria.coverage: All suspicious scheduled task patterns monitored

name: Cloud API Abuse and Reconnaissance
description: Detect anomalous cloud API activity indicating compromised credentials, privilege escalation attempts, or reconnaissance in AWS, Azure, and GCP environments
hypothesis: Adversaries with compromised cloud credentials perform reconnaissance and privilege escalation through excessive or suspicious API calls
default_query: cloud_provider in ("AWS", "Azure", "GCP") AND (api_call matches ".*List.*|.*Get.*|.*Describe.*" OR error_code in ("AccessDenied", "UnauthorizedOperation", "Forbidden")) AND (api_calls_per_hour > 100 OR unique_api_calls_per_hour > 30 OR error_rate > 0.3)
investigation_steps: Identify accounts with abnormal API call volumes or patterns
Review API calls for enumeration patterns (List/Get/Describe)
Analyze source IP addresses and user-agent strings
Check for AccessDenied errors indicating privilege escalation attempts
Correlate with identity compromise indicators
Review IAM policy changes and role assumptions
detection_tuning: Baseline normal API usage patterns by service account
Whitelist automation tools and CI/CD pipelines
Exclude monitoring and management consoles
Adjust thresholds based on cloud environment size

success_criteria.coverage: Major cloud platforms and critical APIs monitored
